sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: BKLC Stock Fund Price and Chart — AMEX:BKLC
feed.summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the BNY Mellon US Large Cap Core Equity ETF (BKLC), including its price, performance metrics, key statistics like AUM and dividend yield, and its investment strategy. It highlights that BKLC is the first ETF to launch with zero total operating expenses and tracks an index of the top 500 US corporations. The article also includes technical analysis, seasonal trends, and a comprehensive FAQ section addressing common investor questions about ETFs and BKLC.

feed.title: BAMV Stock Fund Price and Chart — CBOE:BAMV
feed.summary: BAMV, the Brookstone Value Stock ETF, seeks capital appreciation by investing in U.S. companies with strong value. The fund is actively managed, focusing on mid- to large-cap companies that are either undervalued or reasonably priced, and selects approximately 30 high-quality, value-oriented stocks. As of the article, BAMV has $97.53 million in assets under management and an expense ratio of 0.91%.

feed.title: UBS Cuts Target on Progressive (PGR), Maintains Neutral Rating
feed.summary: UBS analyst Brian Meredith lowered the price target for The Progressive Corporation (NYSE:PGR) from $226 to $218, while maintaining a Neutral rating. This decision follows mixed analyst sentiments, with Morgan Stanley reiterating a Sell rating and Roth Capital having previously lowered its target but keeping a Buy rating. Despite these adjustments, 41% of analysts recommend a Buy on PGR, noting a 1-year average upside of 14.63%.

feed.title: TD Cowen Reiterates Hold on Raymond James Financial (RJF) Shares

Santelli, Executive Vice President and General Counsel, who sold 4,500 shares totaling $767,070 earlier in February.

feed.title: A Look At Genuine Parts (GPC) Valuation As Business Separation And Strong Buy Upgrade Take Shape
feed.summary: Raymond James has upgraded Genuine Parts (GPC) to Strong Buy following the company's announcement of plans to separate its automotive and industrial businesses, alongside new earnings and 2026 guidance. Despite a recent share price decline, the stock is considered 18.9% undervalued by analysts, with a fair value estimate of around $147. The company's restructuring, M&A plans, and dividend growth are expected to drive future earnings, although risks like inflation and European market softness could impact margins.

feed.title: FIS Debt Raise And AI Launch Reframe Growth And Valuation Story
feed.summary: Fidelity National Information Services (FIS) has announced a significant debt raise through senior notes to finance its acquisition of Global Payments’ Issuer Solutions business and has launched an AI-powered Insurance Risk Suite Assistant. These moves are expected to reframe FIS's growth and valuation story by solidifying its position in core payments and issuer processing, while extending its reach in the insurance sector with AI-driven tools. Investors should consider the impact of new debt, FIS's P/E ratio compared to sector averages, and the contribution of new businesses to its revenue base.

feed.title: Morgan Stanley Maintains Hold on Assurant (AIZ) With $248 Target
feed.summary: Morgan Stanley analyst Bob Huang maintained a Hold rating on Assurant, Inc. (AIZ) with a price target of $248, marking the second such update this month. This follows strong Q4 2025 earnings for Assurant, highlighting its ninth consecutive year of profitable growth with adjusted EPS up 12%. The company, a specialist in lifestyle and housing protection, plans a share repurchase range of $250 million to $350 million for 2026.

feed.title: Hormel Foods Q1 Earnings Call Highlights
feed.summary: Hormel Foods reported a "solid" first fiscal quarter for 2026, achieving 2% organic net sales growth and adjusted diluted EPS of $0.34, primarily driven by strong performances in Foodservice and International segments. The company faced challenges from commodity inflation, particularly in beef and pork trim, and increased logistics costs, which pressured gross profit. Hormel also announced the sale of its whole-bird turkey business to reduce exposure to volatile, low-margin operations and reaffirmed its full-year guidance, expecting restructuring savings to begin in Q2.

feed.title: Procter & Gamble: Why Analysts See a $216 Mid-Case Valuation
feed.summary: Analysts are providing a mid-case valuation of $216 for Procter & Gamble (PG) stock, implying a 29.5% total return, driven by the company's strategic growth interventions, particularly in Latin America and China. While Wall Street currently shows modest upside, the valuation model suggests PG is undervalued for patient investors awaiting the results of U.S. organic sales recovery and the national retail rollout of Tide evo in Q3 FY26. The company's AI-powered initiatives, autonomous supply chain, and brand-building through generative AI are positioning it for sustained category leadership.

feed.title: PepsiCo takes the Poppi brand international as it looks to ride the prebiotic wave (PEP:NASDAQ)
feed.summary: PepsiCo (PEP) is expanding its Poppi prebiotic soda brand internationally, signaling its confidence in the brand's continued strong growth. Acquired approximately a year ago, Poppi is positioned as PepsiCo's next major beverage success. The initial international expansion highlights PepsiCo's strategy to capitalize on the growing demand for prebiotic products.
